register.description: McSPI module revision identifier Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: McSPI Module Revision

register.description: Information about the module's hardware configuration.

bitfield.description: Reserved These bits are initialized to 0, and writes to them are ignored.
Retention Mode. This bit field indicates whether the retention mode is supported. 0x0: Retention mode disabled 0x1: Retention mode enabled
FIFO number of bytes parameter
Use of a FIFO enable. This bit indicates if a FIFO is integrated within controller design with its management.

bitenum.description: FIFO and its management implemented in design

register.description: Clock management configuration

bitfield.description: Configuration of the local target state management mode. By definition, target can handle read/write transaction as long as it is out of IDLE state.

bitenum.description: Force-idle mode: local target's IDLE state follows (acknowledges) the system's IDLE requests unconditionally, that is, regardless of the module's internal requirements. Backup mode, for debug only.
No-idle mode: local target never enters IDLE state. Backup mode, for debug only.

Smart-idle mode: local target's IDLE state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's IDLE requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements. Module shall not generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wake-up events.

Smart-idle wake-up-capable mode: local target's IDLE state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's IDLE requests, depending on the module's internal requirements. Module may generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wake-up events when in IDLE state. Mode is relevant only if the appropriate IP module 'swake-up' output(s) is (are) implemented.

bitfield.description: Sensitivity to emulation (debug) suspend input signal.

bitenum.description: Module is sensitive to emulation suspend.
Module is not sensitive to emulation suspend.

bitfield.description: Software reset. (Optional)

register.description: This register contains the McSPI revision number.

bitfield.description: Reads return 0
McSPI core revision [7:4] Major revision [3:0] Minor revision Examples: 0x10 for 1.0, 0x21 for 2.1

register.description: This register allows controlling various parameters of the configuration interface and is not affected by software reset.

bitfield.description: Reads return 0
Clocks activity during wake-up mode period

bitenum.description: Interface and functional clocks may be switched off.
Interface clock is maintained. Functional clock may be switched off.
Functional clock is maintained. Interface clock may be switched off.
Interface and functional clocks are maintained.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0
Power management

bitenum.description: If an IDLE request is detected, the McSPI acknowledges it unconditionally and goes in inactive mode. Interrupt, DMA requests and wake-up lines are unconditionally deasserted and the module wake-up capability is deactivated even if the [2] ENAWAKEUP bit is set.
If an IDLE request is detected, the request is ignored and the module does not switch to wake-up mode, and keeps on behaving normally.
If an IDLE request is detected, the module will switch to wake-up mode based on its internal activity, and the wake-up capability can be used if the bit [2] ENAWAKEUP is set.

bitfield.description: Wake-up feature control
Software reset. During reads it always returns 0.

bitenum.description: (write) Set this bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware.

bitfield.description: Internal interface clock-gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic interface clock gating strategy is applied, based on the interface activity.

register.description: This register provides status information about the module excluding the interrupt status information.

bitfield.description: Reserved for future module specific status information. Read returns 0.
Internal reset monitoring

register.description: The interrupt status regroups all the status of the module internal events that can generate an interrupt.

bitfield.description: Reads return 0
End of word count event when a channel is enabled using the FIFO buffer and the channel had sent the number of SPI word defined byMCSPI_XFERLEVEL[31:16] WCNT.
Wake-up event in slave mode when an active control signal is detected on the SPIEN line programmed in the fieldMCSPI_CHxCONF[22:21] SPIENSLV
Reads returns 0
Receiver register is full or almost full. Only when Channel 3 is enabled

Transmitter register underflow. Only when Channel 3 is enabled. The transmitter register is empty (not updated by host or DMA with new data) before its time slot assignment. Exception: No TX_underflow event when no data has been loaded into the transmitter register since channel has been enabled.
Transmitter register is empty or almost empty. Note: Enabling the channel automatically rises this event.
Reads returns 0.
Receiver register full or almost full. Channel 2
Transmitter register underflow. Channel 2
Transmitter register empty or almost empty. Channel 2
Reads returns 0
Receiver register full or almost full. Channel 1
Transmitter register underflow. Channel 1
Transmitter register empty or almost empty. Channel 1
Receiver register overflow (slave mode only). Channel 0
Receiver register full or almost full. Channel 0
Transmitter register underflow. Channel 0
Transmitter register empty or almost empty. Channel 0

register.description: This register allows enabling/disabling of the module internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Reads return 0.
End of Word count Interrupt Enable.
Wake-up event interrupt enable in slave mode when an active control signal is detected on the SPIEN line programmed in theMCSPI_CHxCONF[22:21] SPIENSLV bits
Reads returns 0.
Receiver register Full Interrupt Enable. Channel 3
Transmitter register Underflow Interrupt Enable. Channel 3
Transmitter register Empty Interrupt Enable. Channel 3
Reads return 0.
Receiver register Full Interrupt Enable. Channel 2
Transmitter register Underflow Interrupt Enable. Channel 2
Transmitter register Empty Interrupt Enable. Channel 2
Reads return 0.
Receiver register Full Interrupt Enable. Channel 1
Transmitter register Underflow Interrupt Enable. Channel 1
Transmitter register Empty Interrupt Enable. Channel 1
Receiver register Overflow Interrupt Enable. Channel 0
Receiver register Full Interrupt Enable. Channel 0
Transmitter register Underflow Interrupt Enable. Channel 0
Transmitter register Empty Interrupt Enable. Channel 0

register.description: The wake-up enable register allows enabling and disabling of the module internal sources of wakeup on event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
Wake-up functionality in slave mode when an active control signal is detected on the SPIEN line programmed in theMCSPI_CHxCONF[22:21] SPIENSLV bits

bitenum.description: The event is not allowed to wake-up the system, even if the global control bit[2] ENAWAKEUP is set.
The event is allowed to wake-up the system if the global control bit[2] ENAWAKEUP is set.

register.description: This register is used to check the correctness of the system interconnect either internally to peripheral bus, or externally to device I/O pads, when the module is configured in system test (SYSTEST) mode.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
Set status bit

bitenum.description: No action. Writing 0 does not clear already set status bits. This bit must be cleared before trying to clear a status bit of the register.
Force to 1 all status bits of register. Writing 1 into this bit sets to 1 all status bits in the register.

bitfield.description: Set the direction of the SPIEN[3:0] lines and SPICLK line.
Set the direction of the SPIDAT[1].
Set the direction of the SPIDAT[0].
SWAKEUP output (signal data value of internal signal to system). The signal is driven high or low according to the value written into this bit.

SPICLK line (signal data value) If [10] SPIENDIR = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the CLKSPI line (high or low), and a write into this bit has no effect. If [10] SPIENDIR = 0 (output mode direction), the CLKSPI line is driven high or low according to the value written into this bit.

SPIDAT[1] line (signal data value) If [9] SPIDATDIR1 = 0 (output mode direction), the SPIDAT[1] line is driven high or low according to the value written into this bit. If [9] SPIDATDIR1 = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the SPIDAT[1] line (high or low), and a write into this bit has no effect.

SPIDAT[0] line (signal data value) If [8] SPIDATDIR0 = 0 (output mode direction), the SPIDAT[0] line is driven high or low according to the value written into this bit. If [8] SPIDATDIR0 = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the SPIDAT[0] line (high or low), and a write into this bit has no effect.

SPIEN[3] line (signal data value) If [10] SPIENDIR = 0 (output mode direction), the SPIENT[3] line is driven high or low according to the value written into this bit. If [10] SPIENDIR = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the SPIEN[3] line (high or low), and a write into this bit has no effect.

SPIEN[2] line (signal data value) If [10] SPIENDIR = 0 (output mode direction), the SPIENT[2] line is driven high or low according to the value written into this bit. If [10] SPIENDIR = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the SPIEN[2] line (high or low), and a write into this bit has no effect.

SPIEN[1] line (signal data value) If [10] SPIENDIR = 0 (output mode direction), the SPIENT[1] line is driven high or low according to the value written into this bit. If [10] SPIENDIR = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the SPIEN[1] line (high or low), and a write into this bit has no effect.

SPIEN[0] line (signal data value) If [10] SPIENDIR = 0 (output mode direction), the SPIENT[0] line is driven high or low according to the value written into this bit. If [10] SPIENDIR = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the SPIEN[0] line (high or low), and a write into this bit has no effect.

register.description: This register is dedicated to the configuration of the serial peripheral interface.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.

FIFO DMA address 256-bit aligned This bit is used when a FIFO is managed by the module and DMA connected to the controller provides only 256-bit aligned address. If this bit is set the enabled channel which uses the FIFO has its data managed through MCSPI_DAFTX and MCSPI_DAFRX registers instead of MCSPI_TXx and MCSPI_RXx registers.

bitenum.description: FIFO data managed by and registers.
FIFO data managed by and registers.

bitfield.description: Multiple word interface access: this bit can only be used when a channel is enabled using a FIFO. It allows the system to perform multiple SPI word access for a single 32-bit interface word access. This is possible for WL &lt; 16.

bitenum.description: Multiple word access enabled with FIFO

bitfield.description: Initial SPI delay for first transfer: this field is an option only available in SINGLE master mode. The controller waits for a delay to transmit the first SPI word after channel enabled and corresponding TX register filled. This delay is based on SPI output frequency clock. No clock output provided to the boundary and chip select is not active in 4-pin mode within this period.

bitenum.description: No delay for first spi transfer.
The controller wait 4 SPI bus clock
The controller wait 8 SPI bus clock
The controller wait 16 SPI bus clock
The controller wait 32 SPI bus clock

bitfield.description: Enables the system test mode

bitenum.description: Master - The module generates the SPICLK and SPIEN[3:0].
Slave - The module receives the SPICLK and SPIEN[3:0].

bitfield.description: Pin mode selection: This bit is used in master or slave mode to configure the SPI pin mode (3-pin or 4-pin). If asserted the controller only uses SIMO, SOMI, and SPICLK clock pin for SPI transfers.

bitenum.description: SPIEN is used as a chip-select.
SPIEN is not used. In this mode all related options to chip-select have no meaning.

bitfield.description: Single channel/Multi Channel (master mode only)

bitenum.description: More than one channel will be used in master mode.
Only one channel will be used in master mode. This bit must be set in Force SPIEN[x] mode.

register.description: This register is dedicated to the configuration of the channel x

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.

Clock divider granularity this bit defines the granularity of channel clock divider: power of 2 or one clock cycle granularity. When this bit is set the register MCSPI_CHxCTRL[15:8] EXTCLK must be configured to reach a maximum of 4096 clock divider ratio. Then the clock divider ratio is a concatenation of [5:2] CLKD and MCSPI_CHxCTRL[15:8] EXTCLK values
FIFO enabled for receive: Only one channel can have this bit field set.

bitenum.description: The buffer is not used to receive data.
The buffer is used to receive data.

bitfield.description: FIFO enabled for transmit: Only one channel can have this bit field set.

bitenum.description: The buffer is not used to transmit data.
The buffer is used to transmit data.

bitfield.description: Chip-select time control This 2-bit field defines the number of interface clock cycles between CS toggling and first or last edge of SPI clock.
Start-bit polarity

bitenum.description: Start-bit polarity is held to 0 during SPI transfer.
Start-bit polarity is held to 1 during SPI transfer.

bitfield.description: Start-bit enable for SPI transfer

bitenum.description: Default SPI transfer length as specified by WL bit field
Start bit D/CX added before SPI transfer. Polarity is defined by bit [24] SBPOL

bitfield.description: Channel 0 only and slave mode only: SPI slave select signal detection. Reserved bits for other cases.
Manual SPIEN assertion to keep SPIEN active between SPI words (single channel master mode only).

bitenum.description: Writing 0 into this bit drives low the SPIEN line when [6] EPOL=0, and drives it high when [6] EPOL=1.
Writing 1 into this bit drives high the SPIEN line when [6] EPOL=0, and drives it low when [6] EPOL=1.

bitfield.description: Turbo mode

bitenum.description: Turbo is deactivated (recommended for single SPI word transfer).
Turbo is activated to maximize the throughput for multiple SPI words transfer.

bitfield.description: Input Select
Transmission enable for data line 1
Transmission Enable for data line 0

DMA read request The DMA read request line is asserted when the channel is enabled and a new data is available in the receive register of the channel. The DMA read request line is deasserted on read completion of the receive register of the channel.

DMA write request. The DMA write request line is asserted when The channel is enabled and the transmitter register of the channel is empty. The DMA write request line is deasserted on load completion of the transmitter register of the channel.
Transmit/receive modes
SPI word length

bitenum.description: The SPI word is 4 bits long
The SPI word is 5 bits long
The SPI word is 6 bits long
The SPI word is 7 bits long
The SPI word is 8 bits long
The SPI word is 9 bits long
The SPI word is 10 bits long
The SPI word is 11 bits long
The SPI word is 12 bits long
The SPI word is 13 bits long
The SPI word is 14 bits long
The SPI word is 15 bits long
The SPI word is 16 bits long
The SPI word is 17 bits long
The SPI word is 18 bits long
The SPI word is 19 bits long
The SPI word is 20 bits long
The SPI word is 21 bits long
The SPI word is 22 bits long
The SPI word is 23 bits long
The SPI word is 24 bits long
The SPI word is 25 bits long
The SPI word is 26 bits long
The SPI word is 27 bits long
The SPI word is 28 bits long
The SPI word is 29 bits long
The SPI word is 30 bits long
The SPI word is 31 bits long
The SPI word is 32 bits long

bitfield.description: SPIEN polarity

bitenum.description: SPIEN is held high during the ACTIVE state.
SPIEN is held low during the ACTIVE state.

bitfield.description: Frequency divider for SPICLK (only when the module is a Master SPI device). A programmable clock divider divides the SPI reference clock (FCLK) with a 4-bit value, and results in a new clock SPICLK available to shift-in and shift-out data. By default, the clock divider ratio has a power of 2 granularity when [29] CLKG is cleared. Otherwise, this field is the 4-LSB bit of a 12-bit register concatenated with clock divider extensionMCSPI_CHxCTRL[15:8] EXTCLK register. The value description below defines the clock ratio when [29] CLKG is set to 0.
SPICLK polarity (see, Transfer Format)

bitenum.description: SPICLK is held low during the INACTIVE state
SPICLK is held high during the INACTIVE state

bitfield.description: SPICLK phase (see, Transfer Format)

bitenum.description: Data are latched on odd-numbered edges of SPICLK.
Data are latched on even-numbered edges of SPICLK.

register.description: This register is dedicated to the configuration of the channel x

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.

Clock divider granularity this bit defines the granularity of channel clock divider: power of 2 or one clock cycle granularity. When this bit is set the register MCSPI_CHxCTRL[15:8] EXTCLK must be configured to reach a maximum of 4096 clock divider ratio. Then the clock divider ratio is a concatenation of [5:2] CLKD and MCSPI_CHxCTRL[15:8] EXTCLK values

register.description: This register provides status information about transmitter and receiver registers of channel x.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
Channel x FIFO receive buffer full status

bitenum.description: FIFO receive buffer is not full

bitfield.description: Channel x FIFO receive buffer empty status

bitenum.description: FIFO receive buffer is not empty

bitfield.description: Channel x FIFO transmit buffer full status

bitenum.description: FIFO transmit buffer is not full

bitfield.description: Channel x FIFO transmit buffer empty status

bitenum.description: FIFO transmit buffer is not empty

bitfield.description: Channel x end of transfer status. The definitions of beginning and end of transfer vary with master versus slave and the transfer format (transmit/receive modes, turbo mode). See dedicated chapters for details.

bitenum.description: This flag is automatically cleared when the shift register is loaded with the data from the transmitter register (beginning of transfer).
This flag is automatically set to one at the end of an SPI transfer.

bitfield.description: Channel x transmitter register status

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.

register.description: This register is dedicated to enable channel x.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.

Clock ratio extension: this field is used to concatenate with MCSPI_CHxCONF[5:2] CLKD register for clock ratio only when granularity is one clock cycle (MCSPI_CHxCONF[29] CLKG set to 1). Then the maximum value reached is 4096 clock divider ratio.
Read returns 0.
Channel enable

register.description: This register is dedicated to enable channel x.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.

Clock ratio extension: this field is used to concatenate with MCSPI_CHxCONF[5:2] CLKD register for clock ratio only when granularity is one clock cycle (MCSPI_CHxCONF[29] CLKG set to 1). Then the maximum value reached is 4096 clock divider ratio.
Read returns 0.

register.description: This register contains a single SPI word for channel x to transmit on the serial link, whatever SPI word length is.

register.description: This register provides transfer levels needed while using FIFO buffer during transfer.

bitfield.description: SPI word counter. This field holds the programmable value of number of SPI word to be transferred on channel which is using the FIFO buffer. When transfer had started, a read back in this field returns the current SPI word transfer index.

Buffer almost full This field holds the programmable almost-full level value used to determine almost full buffer condition. If the user wants an interrupt or a DMA read request to be issued during a receive operation when the data buffer holds at least n bytes, then the buffer AFL must be set with n-1.

Buffer almost empty. this field holds the programmable almost-empty level value used to determine almost empty buffer condition. If the user wants an interrupt or a DMA write request to be issued during a transmit operation when the data buffer is able to receive n bytes, then the buffer AEL must be set with n-1.

register.description: This register contains the SPI words to be transmitted on the SPI bus when FIFO is used and DMA address is aligned on 256 bit. This register is an image of one of the registers corresponding to the channel which has its FIFO enabled.

bitfield.description: FIFO data to transmit with DMA 256 bit aligned address.This field is only used when[8] FDAA is set to 0x1 and only one of the enabled channels has the [27] FFEW bit set to 0x1. If these conditions are not met any access to this field returns a null value. enum=Disable .

register.description: This register contains the SPI words received from the SPI bus when FIFO is used and DMA address is aligned on 256 bit. This register is an image of one of the registers corresponding to the channel which has its FIFO enabled.

bitfield.description: FIFO data received with DMA 256 bit aligned address.This field is only used when[8] FDAA is set to 0x1 and only one of the enabled channels has the [28] FFER bit set to 0x1. If these conditions are not met any access to this field returns a null value. enum=Disable .
